clues.text: Slang for 25¢

Shakespeare patterned this villainess after Gruoch, who bore the blood of Scottish kings

An illegitimate child of Pope Alexander VI, her reputation was "poisoned" by incest rumors
Compulsive nymphomaniac who made life a "mess" for her Roman emperor husband, Claudius

When this explorer-general freed Missouri's slaves, Lincoln freed him of his command

A bird called the megapode is distinctive in doing this to eggs not with body heat but using solar or geothermal energy

clues.text: Scientists believe the songs of this genus Megaptera whale, which change from year to year, are part of a mating ritual
The saltwater this, the largest living reptile, can bodysurf currents, which is why it's found on South Pacific isles

Spanish for "devil", it's northern California's version of a Santa Ana wind
These winds that blow west get their name from an old word for a regular course, not from helping commerce

rounds.text: The specific skill that gave this sport its name was eliminated from international competition after the 1990 World Championships
